intro.p: The GStreamer team is proud to announce the first bugfix release in the stable 1.8 release series of your favourite cross-platform multimedia framework!
This release only contains bugfixes and it is safe to update from 1.8.0. For a full list of bugfixes see Bugzilla.
See &site;/releases/1.8/ for the full release notes.

This module, gstreamer, only contains core functionality. For actual media playback, you will need other modules.
gst-plugins-base contains a basic set of well-supported plugins gst-plugins-good contains a set of well-supported plugins under our preferred license gst-plugins-ugly contains a set of well-supported plugins, but might pose problems for distributors gst-plugins-bad contains a set of less supported plugins that haven't passed the rigorous quality testing we expect, or are still missing documentation and/or unit tests gst-libav contains a set of codecs plugins based on libav (formerly gst-ffmpeg)

bug.summary: doc: Drop reference to osssink / esdsink / etc, from gst-launch-1.0 man page
GST_DEBUG categories are missing when using --gst-debug-help
gstpad: Fix race between gst_element_remove_pad and state change
queue: Use full running time for level calculation
valve: don't send sticky events as a direct response to upstream events
multiqueue: Make sure mq- > percent remains valid after modifying high-percent value
baseparse: When initializing DTS from PTS, remember that we did so
